p: In this issue of the journal, Tang and colleagues from the Tongji Medical College in Wuhan (the initial source of the 2019‐nCoV epidemic) describe their experience with the association of 2019‐nCoV pneumonia and disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) over the first 6 weeks of the epidemic. Their findings highlight that evidence of DIC is a strong predictor of mortality in patients developing pneumonia with this virus.
